results.title: Problems of conservation
results.brief_description: Highlights problems in the United States associated with the depletion of non-renewable natural resources; forest, mineral, wildlife and the associated problem of increasing air pollution. Discusses intervention strategies.

results.title: Solar water heating
results.creator_credit: Ted Davey, Roger Morse, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Collecting solar energy for use in water heaters. A CSIRO scientist explains how the absorbers work and, with the aid of diagrams, how they operate on the principle of thermo-cyclic-flow. Their installation and economy are also demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ted Davey, Roger Morse, S.T. Evans and CSIRO

results.title: Snow safe
results.creator_credit: Jack Creswick and Australian Ski Patrol Association
results.brief_description: A well produced video looking at all aspects of ski and snow safety. Covers appropriate clothing and equipment, selection of equipment, getting proper ski instruction, ski slope courtesy and behaviour, using lifts, ski slope signs, what to do in case of accident or getting lost, care of children, food and hypothermia, and safe tobogganing. Narrated by Debbie Byrne.

results.title: Soil
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Shows what soil is and how it is formed - then illustrates the damaging effects of water and wind erosion. Another damaging depletion is the loss of nutrients in the soil. Illustrates with on the spot examples of how the U.S. conservation service in 1969 combated these projects that range from contour ploughing to land use planning.

results.title: Orbost v Orbost
results.creator_credit: David Wood, John Sparkes and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Orbost in Victoria is a fairly normal country town, but it has one outstanding feature - two football clubs. Every winter, football becomes the focal point in the lives of most of the local people, and it provides a good deal of their social life. In this film the two local teams compete in the district final, and football fever reaches its highest pitch.

results.title: Wildlife
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Explains the need for conservation of wildlife in order to preserve the ecological balance of nature. Describes the endangered status of many species today, what has been done to control impending extinction in the past, and what can be done in the future through refuges. In collaboration with Allan A. Sollers, author of “Ours is the Earth”.

results.title: Minerals
results.creator_credit: Bill Erwin, John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Introduces a variety of mineral resources vital to our present way of life. Emphasises that many of these resources are non-renewable and shows current efforts directed towards conserving mineral resources.

results.title: Be it ever so humble
results.creator_credit: Ron Iddon, John Sparkes and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Shot in Queensland, this film examines the development in styles of houses in Australia, from the slab hut to the contemporary brick house. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.

results.title: Sneakers
results.creator_credit: Phil Alden Robinson, Lindsley Lindsley Parsons, Walter Parkes, Lawrence Lasker and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Martin Bishop heads an organisation of computer hackers, technology experts, reformed thieves and outsiders who are paid to break into high-security institutions in order to prove their vulnerability. Several shady characters approach Martin to steal an electronic code-breaker that is a risk to national security. Against his instincts Martin accepts the assignment when they threaten to expose his true identity. Naturally nothing goes to plan, and the friends find themselves in peril when they realise the decoder’s awesome potential for destruction. What transpires is a thriller entailing conspiracy theories, double-crossings, a corrupt government and murder. “Sneakers” is quite amusing and, at times, somewhat fraught with tension, as the team battle a myriad of forces. Pre-dating the late 1990s, early 2000s paranoid computer-hacker films, “Sneakers” has a sprightliness that impresses and despite an overabundance of contrivances, makes for a satisfying caper. Top cast includes Robert Redford, Sidney Poitier, Ben Kingsley, Dan Ackroyd, Mary McDonnell, River Phoenix and David Strathairn.

results.title: Forest and range
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Presents “multiple use programmes” in which American forests are used for produce in addition to recreation. This program juxtaposes the need for food, lumber and recreation against the desire to retain undeveloped areas.
